intro: Ginannia lanata, commonly known as the woolly ginannia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woolly leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. Ginannia lanata is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
